meanings.definition: The state of being strikingly different from something else.
meanings.sent1: The contrast between the black cat and the white cat was very noticeable.
meanings.sent2: The artist used a lot of contrast in his painting to make it more interesting.
meanings.sent3: It was funny to see the contrast between the tiny puppy and the huge dog.
meanings.sent4: The contrast of the bright sun against the dark storm clouds was breathtaking.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a lot of contrast in the lesson to help the students understand better.

meanings.definition: To compare in order to show differences.
meanings.sent1: Let's contrast the two options to see which one is better.
meanings.sent2: She likes to contrast different styles of music to appreciate their uniqueness.
meanings.sent3: I will contrast the prices of the two stores before deciding where to buy.
meanings.sent4: His calm demeanor contrasted sharply with her loud and energetic personality.
meanings.sent5: The chef likes to contrast flavors to create exciting dishes.

meanings.definition: A difference or dissimilarity between things.
meanings.sent1: There was a clear contrast between the two candidates' policies.
meanings.sent2: The contrast in temperature between day and night was quite extreme.
meanings.sent3: The contrast in size between the elephant and the mouse was comical.
meanings.sent4: The contrast in opinions led to a lively debate among the group.
meanings.sent5: The contrast in colors made the painting stand out.
